title: Cottage Cheese Pie Recipe
full_text:
Cottage Cheese Pie Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
15 mins
Cook
40 mins
Active
30 mins
Chilling Time
2 hrs
Total
2 hrs 55 mins
Serves
10 servings
Makes
1 pie
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
For the Crust:
1 1/2
cups
(
7 1/2
ounces
)
all-purpose flour
1/8
teaspoon
baking powder
3
ounces
cream cheese
(chilled, cubed)
8
tablespoons
(
1
stick
)
unsalted butter
(chilled, cubed)
2
tablespoons
heavy cream
1
teaspoon
vanilla extract
1 1/2
teaspoons
apple cider vinegar
For the Filling:
2
medium
eggs
, beaten
2
tablespoons
all-purpose flour
1
cup
(about
7
ounces
)
white sugar
2
cups
cottage cheese
(preferably full-fat)
1/2
teaspoon
zest
and
2
teaspoons
fresh juice
from
1
whole
lemon
1/4
cup
heavy cream
1
teaspoon
vanilla extract
Directions
For the Crust:
Pulse flour, pinch of salt, and baking powder in a food processor until combined, about 10 short pulses. Add cream cheese and pulse until coarsely incorporated, about 8 short pulses. Add butter cubes and pulse until dough forms pea-sized balls, about 8 short pulses. Add cream, vanilla, and vinegar and continue to pulse until dough pulls away from sides, 8 to 12 short pulses. Transfer dough to a large sheet of plastic wrap and shape into a 1/4-inch thick disc. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 3 days. Remove from refrigerator and press into a 9-inch pie plate, using fingertips to form an even layer.
To Assemble:
Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Whisk together eggs, flour, and sugar using an electric handheld mixture until smooth. Fold in cottage cheese, lemon zest and juice, heavy cream, and vanilla extract. Pour into prepared pie shell. Bake until set in the middle, about 40 minutes. Let cool slightly and serve.
Special Equipment
Food processor
,
handheld mixer
,
9-inch pie plate
Cottage Cheese
Pies
